page.title: 03AGRICULTURE
page.content: {Farming in Wainstalls} Most of the farming in this area is sheep farming. Sheep are reared for wool and meat. Several farmers also keep cows and these are mostly for dairy products and beef. There is one chicken farmer and there was until recently a piggery but this has now closed down. There is virtually no arable farming around here. The farmed land is mostly turned over to grass for hay-making or silage with the occasional crop of cow cabbage. As well as this professional farming, a pattern has shown up of quite a number of people keeping a few animals for their own use. These include hens, geese, rabbits and goats. Many people also grow their own vegetables and a little soft fruit in sheltered areas.
